III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/20/24, youth was attempting to fight another youth at the
facility. A staff member intervened using physical de-escalation
while attempting to get the youth into their room. The technique
pushed the youth into their room and they kept trying to get out.
On 9/28/24, youth went to see the nurse and reported having back
pain due to being slammed into the floor in the room by the staff
member. No injuries appear to be present.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 2, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A
described trying to get at Youth B to fight when Supervisor asked
him to sit down then slammed Youth A to the bed. Youth A stated
Supervisor asked Youth A four to five times to sit down “nicely”
while Youth A was pushing Supervisor. Youth A reported
Supervisor picked Youth A up from behind by grabbing Youth A’s
waist, pulled Youth A back away from Youth B and slammed
Youth A onto the bed. Youth A stated his side and back hit the
bed, causing Youth A to have back pain. Youth A denied having
any marks or bruises and reported seeing Nurse. Youth A
reported Nurse provided an ice pack for Youth A’s hand because
Youth A had punched a door at a different time and his hand hurt.
Youth A stated, “I was the aggressor in the fight with Youth B so
Supervisor was trying to put me in my room so I would chill out.”
Youth A described a female staff (could not recall her name) being
in the unit but did not see Supervisor slam Youth A onto the bed
because the female staff had her back to Supervisor and Youth A.
2

Youth A reported the incident occurred about 4:30-5pm. Youth A
stated he does not know if any other youth saw Supervisor slam
Youth A to the bed. Youth A denied anything else taking place
after the interaction with Supervisor. Youth A reported Supervisor
“cares about us” and will not let the youth fight. Youth A stated
when he was trying to get to Youth B, Supervisor told Youth A and
Youth B that he cared about them, and is not going to let them
fight. Youth A described Supervisor as a “good guy.” Youth A
denied Supervisor ever slamming Youth A or any youth to the
bed, ground, or floor before this incident. Youth A reported he
feels safe at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 2, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C
reported Youth A and Youth B were fighting about something,
Youth C could not recall what, and staff (could not recall who)
broke up the argument. Youth C described the staff standing at
the door blocking Youth A from getting out of Youth A’s room to
get to another youth. Youth C stated he believed the other youth
was Youth B. Youth C stated Youth A was not placed in a
restraint, that it was more like a “bear hug” and was brought to
Youth A’s room by the staff. Youth C reported Youth A and Youth
B never had any physical contact because the staff intervened.
Youth C stated he was unaware if Youth A was injured. Youth C
reported he could not recall the staff’s name. Youth C stated he
likes the staff that was involved in the incident and described the
staff as “cool, looking out for us (youth) but held us (youth)
accountable.” Youth C denied seeing that staff do anything like
that in the past. Youth C reported he feels safe at the facility.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 2, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D
reported he was in his room and heard commotion so went to his
window, looked out and saw Youth A take off his shirt and go after
Youth B. Youth D described leaving his room and seeing
Supervisor “kinda slam Youth A to the bed in Youth A’s room.”
Youth D stated it was not a “big slam or forceful.” Youth D
reported Supervisor was trying to get Youth A to stop and was
standing in between Youth A and Youth B. Youth D described
Supervisor as being in front of Youth A, turning Youth A around
and getting Youth A into Youth A’s room then acting like a barrier
between Youth A and Youth B. Youth D stated Youth A was
getting aggressive toward Supervisor by hitting, and kicking at
him. Youth D stated once Youth A was in Youth A’s bedroom,
Supervisor slammed Youth A onto the bed. Youth D reported he
did not believe Youth A was injured but was not certain. Youth D
3

could not recall if there was another staff or youth who saw what
occurred. Youth D denied ever seeing Supervisor do this to any
youth in the past. Youth D described Supervisor as “fair with
punishments” and like a “father.” Youth D reported he feels safe
at the facility.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 2, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Director
reported the incident between Supervisor and Youth A took place
on September 20, 2024, and was documented when Youth A saw
Nurse on September 28, 2024. Director stated Supervisor is
working on a different pod until the investigation is completed.
Director was asked about the incident being on video and reported
it was, however, there is not video in the bedrooms.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 2, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B
described having an argument with Youth A on September 20,
2024. Youth B reported Supervisor stood in front of Youth A who
kept trying to get around Supervisor. Youth B stated Supervisor
kept telling Youth A to calm down and eventually Youth A did calm
down. Youth B denied ever seeing Supervisor slam Youth A to
the bed or floor or restrain Youth A.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 2, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Therapist described being on the pod when Youth A and Youth B
were verbally arguing. Therapist stated Youth A and Youth B
were both yelling, getting escalated and wanting to fight one
another. Therapist reported Youth B calmed down quickly but
Youth A was still escalated trying to come at Youth A. Therapist
stated Supervisor led Youth A to Youth A’s room while Therapist
talked with Youth B. Therapist reported her back was to
Supervisor and Youth A, so she did not see how Supervisor led
Youth A to Youth A’s room. Therapist denied Youth A saying
anything to her or hearing anything occur between Supervisor and
Youth A. Therapist stated she does not have any concerns with
Supervisor and has never witnessed him being physically
aggressive with any youth. Therapist stated Supervisor used his
body to position himself between Youth A and Youth B to ensure
Youth A did not reach Youth B. Therapist denied seeing
Supervisor slam Youth A to the bed or floor. Therapist stated she
was positive the date of the incident was September 20, 2024,
because it was her brother in laws birthday. Therapist reported
the incident occurred about 4:45pm and when she left work at
6pm the pod was calm.
4

Facility Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility
on October 2, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Facility Manager denied any youth reporting any concerns with
Supervisor. Facility Manager described Supervisor as a “gentle
giant” and being appropriate with the youth.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on October 25,
2024. Supervisor described Youth A being escalated and having
a verbal altercation with Youth B. Supervisor reported Youth A
was more escalated than Youth B. Supervisor stated he escorted
Youth A into his room and stood in between Youth A and Youth B.
Supervisor denied picking up, shoving, slamming Youth A to the
bed, or restraining Youth A. Supervisor reported he is a “bigger
guy” so he just stood in the door so Youth A could not get to Youth
B. Supervisor reported there was another staff in the pod but
could not recall who was working.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 9/20/2024 of Pod J’s common area outside of
Youth A’s bedroom was reviewed with DHHS Worker and
Director. Video shows Youth A standing in front of a chair in front
of Youth A’s bedroom door. It appears Youth A is talking to
someone out of view of the camera. Supervisor and Therapist
enter into view of the camera and walk toward Youth A.
Supervisor stands between Youth A and Youth B who is now in
camera view. It appears Youth A and Youth B are arguing back
and forth and walking toward one another. Therapist walks
toward Youth B and places her hand on Youth B’s arm. Youth B
walks around the chairs in the common area toward Youth A.
Supervisor walks toward Youth B as Youth B gets closer to Youth
A and Supervisor and Youth B go out of camera view. Youth A is
seen standing in the middle of the common area when Supervisor
walks towards Youth A. Youth A walks with Supervisor toward the
chair and sits down.
Video did not show the incident described by Youth A, Youth C, or
Youth D. Video was reviewed for 9/20/24 until approximately 8pm
with no other incidents between Youth A, Youth B, and Supervisor
observed. Video was reviewed for several hours prior to the
described incident above with no other incidents observed
between Youth A, Youth B, and Supervisor. Video of 9/28/24 was
also reviewed because the internal incident report had the date
recorded as 9/28/24. There were no observed incidents between
Youth A, Youth B, and Supervisor on 9/28/24.
5

Supervisor was not observed slamming or restraining any youth in
any of the videos reviewed. Supervisor is not observed entering
Youth A’s bedroom at any point during video review. Youth A is
not observed entering his bedroom at any point during video
review.
Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual Incident Report Summary for Youth A dated
9/28/2024. Summary of the report matches the allegations
from Youth A.
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary
record, and Supervisor completed the required MANDT
System training on 09/16/24 and 09/17/2024.
• Medical Assessment/Progress Note dated 09/28/2024.
Notes document Youth A asking to be examined in medical
office due to being slammed by Supervisor on 09/20/2024
and his back hurting. Youth A reported punching the door
and his hand hurting. Youth A was examined and provided
acetaminophen and scheduled for an X-Ray for his hand.
• Trident Care Medical Radiology Report dated 09/28/2024:
Report documents “No acute abnormality identified.”
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Behavior Management System,
Behavioral Intervention Techniques, Safe Physical
Intervention Policy. Policy documents, the use of verbal
and no-physical crisis intervention communication
intervention techniques will de-escalate the youth and
precent the need for physical intervention; these
communication techniques include listening, supportive
communication, problem solving counseling, conflict
resolution counseling, appropriate attention to non-verbal
cues, attention to the use of physical space and active line
of sight supervision.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per Supervisor’s interview
and camera footage review Supervisor is not seen slamming
Youth A into the floor or bed in Youth A’s room.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
